description: Aloe Vera is a versatile medicinal plant known for its soothing, moisturizing, and healing properties. It boosts immunity and aids digestion, and helps reduce inflammation and skin irritations.
Possible Steps: Consume Aloe Vera juice daily or apply the gel directly on skin wounds and burns for relief and faster healing.

description: Amla, or Indian gooseberry, is rich in vitamin C and antioxidants. It helps improve immunity, promotes heart health, and supports digestion.
Possible Steps: Consume fresh amla, amla powder, or juice regularly to gain its health benefits.

description: Amruta Balli (Giloy) is famous for its detoxifying and immune-boosting effects. It helps fight infections and reduces inflammation.
Possible Steps: Prepare Giloy tea or use Giloy powder as a natural remedy to boost immunity and treat fever.

description: Aralia is a medicinal herb used in traditional medicine to improve energy levels and strengthen the immune system. It also aids in respiratory health.
Possible Steps: Use Aralia leaves in herbal teas or supplements as prescribed by a practitioner.

description: Ashoka is renowned for its use in women's health, particularly in regulating menstrual cycles and treating uterine disorders.
Possible Steps: Consume Ashoka bark extracts or supplements under guidance for reproductive health support.

description: Ashwagandha is an adaptogenic herb known for reducing stress, improving stamina, and boosting immunity. It supports brain health and reduces inflammation.
Possible Steps: Take Ashwagandha powder or capsules daily to combat stress and fatigue.

description: Avocado leaves and fruit contain antioxidants and anti-inflammatory compounds that support heart and skin health.
Possible Steps: Consume ripe avocado fruit regularly; avocado leaf tea may aid digestion.

description: Bamboo shoots are rich in fiber and nutrients; bamboo leaves have antioxidant and antimicrobial properties.
Possible Steps: Use bamboo shoots in cooking; bamboo leaf extracts can be used as natural remedies.

description: Basale is a leafy herb traditionally used to aid digestion and improve appetite.
Possible Steps: Prepare fresh Basale leaf juice or use in cooking for health benefits.

description: Betel leaves have antimicrobial and digestive properties; traditionally used for oral health and digestion.
Possible Steps: Chew fresh betel leaves or prepare betel leaf tea.

description: Betel nut is known for its stimulant properties but should be consumed cautiously due to potential risks.
Possible Steps: Traditionally chewed with betel leaf; use moderately.

description: Brahmi enhances memory and concentration and is widely used to relieve anxiety and stress.
Possible Steps: Consume Brahmi tea or supplements daily for cognitive support.

description: Castor oil is known for its anti-inflammatory and laxative properties; the plant is used medicinally in many cultures.
Possible Steps: Use castor oil topically or as recommended for digestive issues.

description: Curry leaves are rich in antioxidants and help regulate blood sugar and improve digestion.
Possible Steps: Use fresh curry leaves in cooking or prepare curry leaf tea.

description: Doddapatre is traditionally used to reduce fever and promote skin healing.
Possible Steps: Prepare fresh leaf juice or paste and apply as needed.

description: Ekka is a medicinal plant used locally for its anti-inflammatory properties.
Possible Steps: Use Ekka leaf extracts under guidance.

description: Ganike leaves are used to treat digestive issues and enhance appetite.
Possible Steps: Use fresh Ganike leaves in herbal preparations.

description: Guava leaves have antimicrobial and anti-inflammatory effects and aid in digestion.
Possible Steps: Drink guava leaf tea regularly for gastrointestinal health.

description: Geranium has antibacterial properties and is used in skincare and aromatherapy.
Possible Steps: Use geranium essential oil or plant extracts topically.

description: Henna is used for its cooling effects and to treat skin conditions.
Possible Steps: Apply henna paste to skin or hair for therapeutic and cosmetic benefits.

description: Hibiscus flowers and leaves have antioxidant properties and support cardiovascular health.
Possible Steps: Drink hibiscus tea daily or use extracts for skin health.

description: Honge (Pongamia) seeds and leaves have medicinal uses including anti-inflammatory and wound healing.
Possible Steps: Use Honge oil externally for skin ailments; leaves for medicinal teas.

description: Insulin is a hormone, not a plant, and is used medically to regulate blood sugar.
Possible Steps: Consult healthcare provider for insulin therapy.

description: Jasmine flowers are used for relaxation and to reduce anxiety.
Possible Steps: Use jasmine essential oil or flower teas for calming effects.

description: Lemon is rich in vitamin C and antioxidants; supports immunity and digestion.
Possible Steps: Use lemon juice daily; lemon peel powder for detoxification.

description: Lemongrass aids digestion and has antimicrobial properties.
Possible Steps: Brew lemongrass tea or use in cooking for health benefits.

description: Mango leaves and fruit contain antioxidants and vitamins beneficial for immunity.
Possible Steps: Use mango leaf extract and eat fresh mangoes seasonally.

description: Mint is widely used to relieve indigestion, headaches, and nausea.
Possible Steps: Use fresh mint leaves in teas or cooking for digestive relief.

description: Nagadali is used traditionally for respiratory and digestive health.
Possible Steps: Use Nagadali leaf juice or decoctions under guidance.

description: Neem is known for its powerful antimicrobial, anti-inflammatory, and skin healing properties.
Possible Steps: Use neem leaf paste or neem oil for skin and dental care.

description: Nithyapushpa is traditionally used for anti-inflammatory and blood-purifying effects.
Possible Steps: Use flower extracts or powders in herbal remedies.

description: Nooni is used for respiratory and digestive system support.
Possible Steps: Use Nooni leaf juice or powder for medicinal purposes.

description: Papaya contains digestive enzymes; leaves and fruit are used for digestion and skin health.
Possible Steps: Eat ripe papaya fruit; use leaf juice for wound healing.

description: Pepper has antioxidant and digestion-stimulating properties.
Possible Steps: Use black pepper in cooking or supplements to improve digestion.

description: Pomegranate is rich in antioxidants and supports heart health.
Possible Steps: Consume fresh fruit or juice daily for cardiovascular benefits.

description: Raktachandini is used in traditional medicine for blood purification and skin ailments.
Possible Steps: Use extracts or powders in herbal treatments.

description: Rose petals have antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties.
Possible Steps: Use rose water or petal extracts for skin and relaxation benefits.

description: Sapota (chikoo) fruit is nutritious and supports digestion and immunity.
Possible Steps: Eat fresh sapota fruit regularly for health benefits.

description: Tulasi (holy basil) boosts immunity and is used to treat respiratory conditions and stress.
Possible Steps: Brew Tulasi tea daily or use leaves in remedies.

description: Wood sorrel is used for digestive and diuretic purposes traditionally.
Possible Steps: Use fresh leaves in teas or salads.
